result.execSummary:
The defendant William F Kramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $216.00 to be paid to Diana R. as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

As of 12/27/2016:   Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.   Department of Corrections to address financial obligations related to DNA surcharge.

To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with an treatment/counseling.

Sex Offender Assessment and any treatment if needed.
No contact with victim or her family
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
Defendant not to enter any establishments whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.
Defendant to have Sex Offender Treatment, but NOT register as a sex offender.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided.

re: DNA surcharge modification letter signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 11/25/14 sentencing.

Defendant William F Kramer in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1 and Ct. 2. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Sentence withheld for 3 years Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $216.00 to be paid to Diana R. as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Sex offender assessment and any treatment if needed. No contact with victim or her family. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random UA's. Defendant not to enter any establishments whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. Defendant to have Sex offender treatment but NOT register as a sex offender. Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
-  5 months Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing December 4, 2014 by 6:00 p.m..   Non-working hours with standard release conditions including work search and job interviews. 

Ct. 2:
- Sentence withheld for 3 years Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Sex offender assessment and any treatment if needed. No contact with victim or her family. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random UA's. Defendant not to enter any establishments whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. Defendant to have Sex offender treatment but NOT register as a sex offender. Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
From Atty Borda with character and treatment letters exhibits 1-10, filed.
Character letter filed by L.V.
From D.F.
Sentencing hearing on November 25, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant William F Kramer in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed by the State.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 and 2,  Court finds defendant guilty. Parties request a separate date for sentencing. Court grants request. Bail stands as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William F Kramer in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are still working towards a resolution.  Court will set this matter for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed by the State.
Status hearing on July 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant William F Kramer in court with attorney Eduardo M Borda.  Debra L Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense received additional discovery material today. Atty. Borda requests a status date. State requests a status date also. Court will give a status date in 30 days and a trial date in 90 days. Atty. Borda requests a status/trial date in mid October. Court will give a status date in July at this time.  Status hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with the victim or her residence or her employment.   Defendant to have no contact with  any named witnesses listed in the complaint.   Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  No contact with any establishment that primarily serves alcohol.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
